title: Remove personalization UI and flower wording

requirements.summary: Remove the PersonalizationPanel entry point so users cannot access any personalization UI.
acceptanceCriteria: The “Personalize” button is not visible anywhere in the app (idle state and success state).
The personalization sheet cannot be opened via any UI control.
No personalization UI components are rendered in App.tsx.

file_operations.description: Remove the PersonalizationPanel import and remove all rendered PersonalizationPanel JSX so the fixed “Personalize” button and sheet are no longer present in both idle and success states.
Delete the PersonalizationPanel component source so there is no remaining UI entry point for personalization.

requirements.summary: Remove personalization state and localStorage persistence so the Valentine page uses fixed copy/behavior with a single default theme.
acceptanceCriteria: App.tsx does not use the 'valentine-personalization' localStorage key.
The page still displays the two-line headline (name line + “Will you be my Valentine”) and the Yes/No interaction continues to work.
Theme selection via personalization no longer affects the UI (use a single default theme consistently).

file_operations.description: Remove useLocalStorageState usage and all personalization-derived settings. Replace with fixed in-component constants for recipient name, default subtitle, success headline/message, and No-button behavior. Set a single consistent theme (e.g., set document data-theme once on mount) without reading from or writing to localStorage, while keeping the existing Yes/No interaction behavior.
Remove the localStorage state hook since it is no longer used after eliminating personalization persistence.
Remove personalization defaults/types since personalization settings are no longer used by the app.

requirements.summary: Remove the word “flower”/“flowers” from all user-facing text and attributes, replacing with equivalent Valentine-themed wording.
acceptanceCriteria: No visible UI copy contains the word “flower” or “flowers”.
The hero image alt text does not contain the word “flower” or “flowers”.
Success-state card copy that currently references “Flowers” is rewritten to exclude the word while preserving a romantic tone.

file_operations.description: Update all user-facing strings and relevant attributes to remove “flower”/“flowers”, including: the dynamic subtitle variants, the success-state card copy, and the hero image alt text. Ensure revised wording remains Valentine-themed and romantic while keeping the existing interaction flow intact.
